methods.name: list_objects
methods.summary: List objects within a data source
methods.description: List objects within a data source, such as schemas, catalogs, tables and views.

params.name: path
params.description: The path to object that we want to list children.

schema.name: objects
schema.description: Array of objects names and their kinds.

methods.name: list_fields
methods.description: List fields of an object, such as columns of a table or view.

params.name: path
params.description: The path to object that we want to list fields.

schema.name: fields
schema.description: Array of field names and data types.

methods.name: contains_data
methods.summary: Check if an object contains data
methods.description: Check if an object contains data, such as a table or view.

params.name: path
params.description: The path to object that we want to check if it contains data.

schema.name: contains_data
schema.description: Boolean indicating if the object contains data.

methods.name: get_icon
methods.description: Get icon of an object, such as a table or view.

params.name: path
params.description: The path to object that we want to get the icon.

methods.name: preview_object
methods.description: Preview object data, such as a table or view.

params.name: path
params.description: The path to object that we want to preview.

methods.name: get_metadata
methods.description: A connection has tied metadata such as an icon, the host, etc.

params.name: comm_id
params.description: The comm_id of the client we want to retrieve metdata for.

has_children.description: Indicates if the object has children that can be listed. This property is optional and when omitted, it is assumed that the object may have children unless its kind is 'field'.

language_id.description: Language ID for the connections. Essentially just R or python

code.description: Code used to re-create the connection
